definitions.definition: To interact with others, especially personally , informally and off the clock rather than formally and officially .
examples: hoping to socialize a bit at the company holiday party

definitions.definition: To instruct (somebody), usually subconsciously and mostly by example, in the etiquette of a society .
examples: depending on how children are socialized regarding racial and ethnic biases

definitions.definition: To take something into collective or governmental ownership .
examples: fears about potential attempts to socialize medicine

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To interact with others, especially personally , informally and off the clock rather than formally and officially .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To instruct (somebody), usually subconsciously and mostly by example, in the etiquette of a society .
( transitive ) To take something into collective or governmental ownership .
